text:
TITLE:
   Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD, Bronchitis, Emphysema)
   with Acute Exacerbation
   Assessment:
   Patient received on Nasal cannula, Audible insp and exp wheeze , has a
   weak non-productive cough
   Action:
   Patient given MDI  nebs, continued on methylprednisone, PO antibiotics,
   Bipap not used since [**2145-7-7**]
   Response:
   O2 sats maintained in mid to high 90
s on 4 lits of nasal cannula,
   weaned down to 3 lits- o2 sats 94 to 96 %.
   Plan:
   Cont nebs and inhalers, continue methylprednisone for 3 days, continue
   antibiotics
   Impaired Skin Integrity
   Assessment:
   Known chronic venous stasis ulcers,  left ear ? s/p trauma-
   Action:
   DNG
s changed- see wound care RN note for details
   Response:
   No new breaks in skin integrity
   Plan:
   Encourage OOB to change, frequent turning, wound care, prevention of
   further trauma.
   Hyponatremia (low sodium, hyposmolality)
   Assessment:
   PM Na in high 120
   Action:
   1200cc fluid restriction
   Response:
   Am NA + 134, K + 5.3
   Plan:
   Cont to trend lytes, fluid restriction
   .H/O diabetes Mellitus (DM), Type II
   Assessment:
   Frequent blood sugar monitoring, FS  above 150 to 200
s., patient
   consuming Large amts of food- continues to shout for food immediately
   after he has a large quantity.
   Action:
   Continued on diabetic diet, Increased Fixed & sliding scale Insulin
   orders, tried to control diet amount.
   Response:
   BS in am 174.
   Plan:
   Cont blood sugar monitoring.
   Leukopenia
   Assessment:
   WBC trending down. Patient on contact Precautions for MRSA
   Action:
   Continued on azithromycin 250 mgs po daily x 3 doses & Cefpodoxime
   proxetil 200 mgs po Q 12 h x 6 days, Discussed with Resident about the
   WBC in am labs- will add on CBC with differential.
   Response:
   Pending
   Plan:
   ? neutropenic precautions, trend labs.
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   Patient continued to be confused with childlike behaviour ,  wants to
   go home intermittently.
   Action:
    Seen by Team, patient  agreed to stay after being talked to. Continued
   on PO trazodone 600 mgs HS & Ziprasidone 80 mgs [**Hospital1 **]. As per psych
   Patient can have Haldol if agitated, Bilateral wrist restraints applied
   as patient confused & non-compliant with treatment- keeps scrathching
   the ear wound, with moderate to large bleeding. Restraint documented as
   per policy.
   Response:
   Patient slept for couple of hours during the night.
   Plan:
   Continue monitoring.
   .H/O hypertension, benign
   Assessment:
   SBP 140
s to 150
   Action:
   Continued on Po Lisinpil, po diltiazem & Digoxin po
   Response:
   SBP in 120
s to 130
   Plan:
   Continue monitoring.

info.concept: Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease of horses
